snippet: The timing of the extension of martial law added to speculation that the generals might delay handing power to civilian rule.
abstract: Egypt's military-led government issues a decree reimposing martial law ahead of an anticipated court ruling that could delay the presidential election and the promised transition to civilian authority; timing of the announcement on martial law adds to speculation that the generals might retain control beyond the scheduled handing over of power after the election.
lead_paragraph: The timing of the extension of martial law added to speculation that the generals might delay handing power to civilian rule.

headline.seo: Egypt Extends Martial Law Before Election Ruling
headline.main: Egypt Reimposes Martial Law, Ahead of Closely Watched Ruling
headline.print_headline: Egypt Reimposes Martial Law, Ahead of Closely Watched Ruling
